intro: Tribulago blancoi, commonly known as the white tribulus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and spiny leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its structure includes a short stem with compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring. Tribulago blancoi is often found in scrublands and is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to arid climates.
